title: Advanced Computing Concepts
description: Advanced topics in applied computing including design patterns, scalable architectures, and professional practice.

title: Advanced Software Engineering
description: Software lifecycle management, agile processes, testing strategies, and delivery pipelines for enterprise-scale systems.

title: Internet Applications and Distributed Systems
description: Design and evaluation of scalable, distributed applications for the modern internet, covering microservices and event-driven architectures.

title: Advanced Systems Programming
description: Low-level programming, concurrency, and performance engineering for high-reliability systems.

title: Advanced Database Topics
description: Advanced topics in relational, NoSQL, and distributed databases with emphasis on optimization and data governance.

title: Networking and Data Security
description: Network protocols, secure architecture design, threat modeling, and compliance considerations for enterprise environments.

title: Applied Machine Learning
description: Hands-on machine learning with emphasis on applied modeling, evaluation, and deployment in cloud environments.

title: Cloud and DevOps Engineering
description: Infrastructure-as-code, container orchestration, and continuous delivery practices tailored to applied computing projects.

title: Data Analytics for Business
description: Analytics lifecycle, dashboarding, and translating technical insight into business strategy for stakeholders.

title: Human-Centered Computing
description: User-centered design, accessibility, and evaluation methods for applied software products.

title: Applied Computing Project
description: Capstone project or co-op placement applying MAC competencies to an industry problem.

title: Finance in a Global Perspective
description: Financial principles, valuation, and budgeting for technology initiatives in global markets.

title: Marketing Strategy for Technology Ventures
description: Market analysis, positioning, and go-to-market planning for software products and services.

title: Managing for Organizational Effectiveness
description: People management, leadership styles, and organizational behaviour for technical leaders.

title: Topics in Software Engineering
description: Advanced software engineering topics covering emerging methodologies, testing frameworks, and software quality practices.

title: Emerging Paradigms
description: Study of emerging programming paradigms and computational models including functional, reactive, and concurrent programming approaches.

title: Information Retrieval Systems
description: Design and implementation of information retrieval systems, search engines, text processing, and ranking algorithms.

title: Emerging Non-Traditional Database Systems
description: Exploration of modern database technologies including NoSQL, graph databases, time-series databases, and distributed data systems.

title: Virtual Reality
description: Principles and practice of virtual reality systems including 3D graphics, immersive interfaces, and VR application development.

title: 3D Animation and Data Visualization
description: Techniques for 3D animation and interactive data visualization including modeling, rendering, and visual analytics.

title: Advanced Algorithms
description: Advanced algorithmic techniques including dynamic programming, graph algorithms, complexity theory, and optimization methods.

title: Computational Geometry and Applications
description: Study of geometric algorithms and their applications in graphics, robotics, GIS, and spatial data structures.

title: Statistical Learning
description: Statistical approaches to machine learning including regression, classification, resampling methods, and model selection.

title: Neural Networks and Deep Learning
description: Fundamentals and applications of neural networks and deep learning including CNNs, RNNs, and modern architectures.

title: Security and Privacy in the Internet
description: Internet security protocols, cryptographic techniques, privacy-preserving technologies, and secure system design.

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: Core AI concepts including intelligent agents, search, knowledge representation, reasoning, and problem-solving techniques.

title: Machine Learning and Pattern Recognition
description: Machine learning algorithms for pattern recognition including supervised and unsupervised learning, feature extraction, and classification.

title: Applied Artificial Intelligence
description: Practical applications of AI techniques to real-world problems including agent systems, planning, and intelligent system deployment.

title: Finance in a Global Perspective
description: International finance principles, investment strategies, and financial decision-making in global technology markets.

title: Managing for Organizational Effectiveness
description: Leadership principles, organizational behavior, and management strategies for technology-driven organizations.

title: Marketing
description: Marketing principles and strategies for technology products including digital marketing, branding, and customer engagement.
